title: Jameis Winston calls on NFL London fans to help Tampa Bay Buccanneers get back on track
text:

Jameis Winston wants London fans to turn up the volume and fire Tampa Bay’s season back on track.

The Buccaneers’ stuttering start to the season has seen them lose, win, lose, win and lose again.

They have had no problem scoring points but have conceded just as easily, putting up 147 but letting in 148.

And Winston knows that a fourth defeat in six games at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium this afternoon against the Carolina Panthers would deal a crippling blow to their 2019 hopes.

He said: “Last week, we played in the Superdome in New Orleans and that’s a very loud place.

“We enjoy loud atmospheres so we are really hoping the fans come out and are excited and enthusiastic, and help lead us to victory.”

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

Winston is now in his fifth season in the NFL, having emerged in 2015 as the top player in college football and the most sought-after quarterback by the pros.

He understands that a lot is riding on his shoulders but says he accepts the challenge and is ready to meet it.

He said: “To whom much is given, much is required. Being a quarterback in this league is definitely a privilege. We have targets on our back, no matter who you are.

“Being a quarterback of one of the 32 teams is very important in this league. We just have to go in week in, week out and try to silence the critics.”

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

So, will he be nervous playing so far from home, in a new stadium and with a strange crowd?

“Before every game, I get butterflies. No form of nervousness but butterflies and just because I care, and I want us to win so badly.

“But you deal with that with the first play. On the first play you give everything you’ve got and then you empty out the tank.”
